Player History
Had first career hit on 4/4/1985, off Fernando Valenzuela (LAD)...
Earned first career win on 4/4/1985...
Hit first career homerun on 6/8/1985, off Joe Hesketh (MON)...
2/2/1987: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,685,714 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,085,714 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,085,714 through salary arbitration...
10/6/1989: Signed a contract extension with Cincinnati, $730,000 per year, for 2 years.
Traded from Cincinnati to Seattle on 4/3/1990 (Going to CIN: P Kevin Appier. Going to SEA: P Jason Bere, P Tom Browning, 3B Chris Sabo)...
Injured on 8/31/1991 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Signed as a free agent by Boston on 2/7/1992 to a 3-year deal worth $4,444,444 per year...
